title.narrative: OUTPUT 13: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) EMERGENCIES AND EVIDENCE

description.narrative: Improved capacity of national and decentralized government and civil society organizations to manage risks and to prepare and respond to Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) challenges in emergencies, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: More children and their families have access to affordable and safe drinking water, supported by more efficient national strategies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved capacity of national and decentralized government and civil society organizations to manage risks and to prepare andrespond to WASH challenges in emergencies

description.narrative: Estimated 1,200 flood displaced persons, including about 300 children, received critical WASH services, while a further 2,000,including about 500 children, affected by recent tidal waves are receiving support. Preparedness measures have also been strengthened in the face of ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and potential crisis in the Central Sahel in line with the Country Office Emergency Preparedness Plan (EPP). In this regard, a standby PCA has been agreed with Rural Water Development Programme (RWDP) for emergency response. The WASH in Emergency Technical Working Group is also being supported to coordinate EPR activities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/12/2021
